intro: Erysimum eginense, commonly known as the Eginian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Its flowers are yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
